title: UserEskClassification
description: A `userEskClassification` entity contains hierarchical terms called userEsks used for categorizing and classifying data assets and other entities.

id.description: Unique identifier of this entity instance.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this entity.

termCount.description: Total number of children userEsk terms under this userEsk classification. This includes all the children in the hierarchy.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to the userEsk classification.

usageCount.description: Count of how many times the userEsks from this userEsk classification are used.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.

disabled.description: System classifications can't be deleted. Use this flag to disable them.

mutuallyExclusive.description: userEsks under this userEsk classification are mutually exclusive. When mutually exclusive is `true` the userEsks from this userEsk classification are used to **classify** an entity. An entity can only be in one class - example, it can only be either `tier1` or `tier2` and not both. When mutually exclusive is `false`, the userEsks from this userEsk classification are used to **categorize** an entity. An entity have multiple userEsks simultaneously - example a customer can be `newCustomer` and `atRisk` simultaneously.
